subject: RE: [junit] Code Coverage Analysis Tool
msgSnippet: To answer your questions, I would suggest Clover as an alternative to investigate.  I tend to doubt that it comes with an integration for NetBeans, but perhaps
messageBody:
To answer your questions, I would suggest Clover as an alternative to
investigate. I tend to doubt that it comes with an integration for
NetBeans, but perhaps you can glue it in there somehow.

Your second question has an easy answer: Ant. I would VERY surprised if the
coverage tools you've already mentioned didn't have Ant integration. So,
it's not integrated into your IDE, but at least your tests and the coverage
tools could run together.

Good luck...

-----Original Message-----
From: ­¸¤M [mailto:fly_knife_lee@...]
Sent: Wednesday, March 10, 2004 8:28 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Code Coverage Analysis Tool


My team is developing an API, which is not an executable program

I would like to ask are there any code coverage analysis tools can be
integrated with JUnit and NetBean?

I've tried Rational PureCoverage and JCover, but they both requires
an executable test script......so how can I use these tools to
integrate with the test scripts written for JUnit?

Thanks in advance.
